summary: This bill, H.R. 325, introduced in the 119th Congress, proposes to officially rename a geographical feature in Nevada. Specifically, it seeks to designate the peak of Frenchman Mountain, located at latitude 36°10′45″ N and longitude 114°59′52″ W, as "Maude Frazier Mountain". The legislation mandates that any reference to this peak in United States laws, maps, regulations, documents, or other official papers be updated to reflect the new name. The bill was introduced by Representative Titus and has been referred to the Committee on Natural Resources for consideration.
